qas.question: What is the system IBM created using Codd's research?
What did System R work on to change the way data was stored?
When customers first tested IBM's system, what computer language had been added?
What was the name of the database product created by IBM?
What is the system IBM lost using Codd's research?
What did System R avoid to change the way data was stored?
When customers first tested IBM's system, what computer language had been removed?
What was the name of the database product created by IBN?

context: IBM started working on a prototype system loosely based on Codd's concepts as <a0_0><b5_0>System R<b5_0/><a0_0/> in the early 1970s. The first version was ready in <a1_0><b6_0>1974/5<b6_0/><a1_0/>, and work then started on <a2_0><b7_0>multi-table systems<b7_0/><a2_0/> in which the data could be split so that all of the data for a record (some of which is optional) did not have to be stored in a single large "chunk". Subsequent multi-user versions were tested by customers in 1978 and 1979, by which time a standardized query language – <a3_0><b8_0>SQL<b8_0/><a3_0/>[citation needed] – had been added. Codd's ideas were establishing themselves as both workable and superior to CODASYL, pushing IBM to develop a true production version of System R, known as <a4_0><b9_0>SQL/DS, and, later, Database 2 (DB2)<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
